SEARCH
Package com.oblong.jelly

Class PoolServers

java.lang.Object
com.oblong.jelly.PoolServers
public final class PoolServers extends Object
A collection of functions creating and listing PoolServer instances.

Besides a PoolServer factory method, get(com.oblong.jelly.PoolServerAddress, java.lang.String, java.lang.String), this non-instantiable class provides static methods to list available servers, and register callbacks to be invoked when new ones become available. The asynchronous interface accommodates those servers that are able to announce themselves when they join the local network using protocols such as Bonjour or Avahi.

  • Method Details

    • get

      public static PoolServer get(PoolServerAddress address, String name, String subtype)
      Provides an object implementing PoolServer given its address.

      Pool servers are identified by their address, which acts in this respect as a URI.

      If there's no PoolServer with the given address (for instance, because its protocol is not registered), this method returns null.

      The second argument and third arguments denote the server name and subtype. It is safe to pass null for a generic server instance.

    • get

      public static PoolServer get(PoolServerAddress address)

    • get

      public static PoolServer get(String uri, String name, String subtype)
      Convenience method that construct a PoolServerAddress and calls get on it, returning null if the URI is malformed.

    • servers

      public static Set<PoolServer> servers(String scheme, PoolServerAddress address, String name, String subtype)
      Lists the currently known servers for the given scheme, address, name and subtype. Except the first one, all these parameters can be null to denote 'any value'. Of particular interest are those schemes, such as "tcp", corresponding to remote servers that can announce themselves using protocols such as zeroconf. remoteServers(com.oblong.jelly.PoolServerAddress, java.lang.String, java.lang.String) retrieves a list of discovered servers using any of the remote schemes.

    • remoteServers

      public static Set<PoolServer> remoteServers(PoolServerAddress address, String name, String subtype)
      Lists the currently discovered remote servers. Works as servers(String, PoolServerAddress, String, String), but including all registered schemes corresponding to remote servers. Any of the arguments can be null to denote 'any value'. Remote pool servers may be able to annonunce themselves via zeroconf. This method will use that protocol to list servers discovered in the local network.

    • remoteServers

      public static Set<PoolServer> remoteServers()
      Lists all currently known remote servers. Equivalent to calling remoteServers(PoolServerAddress, String, String), with all three arguments equal to null.

    • addListener

      public static boolean addListener(String scheme, PoolServers.Listener listener)
      Adds a listener for server addition or removal. Using listeners allows treating server announcements (e.g., via zeroconf) in an asynchronous manner, and lets you keep up to date the list of extant servers using a push model (as is typical, for instance, in zeroconf service browsers.

      The listener will only react to additions or removals of servers with the given scheme. See also addRemoteListener(com.oblong.jelly.PoolServers.Listener).

    • addRemoteListener

      public static void addRemoteListener(PoolServers.Listener listener)
      Registers the given listener for all remote schemes.
      See Also:
      • addListener(java.lang.String, com.oblong.jelly.PoolServers.Listener)
